dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2023, Melinda Gates and Steve Forbes had this wild conversation at The Janagers Club of New Jersey.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty three, Melinda Gates and Steve Forbes had this wild conversation at The Janagers Club of New Jersey.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Steve Forbes was there promoting his book, The Moment of Descent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Steve Forbes was there promoting his book, The Moment of Descent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, the one about disempowering men? I uh, heard it's been getting some pretty intense reactions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, the one about disempowering men? I uh, heard it's been getting some pretty intense reactions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he announced he's committing a billion dollars to prevent gender equality. A billion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he announced he's committing a billion dollars to prevent gender equality. A billion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What makes this interview especially timely is her announcement that she is committing $1 billion to promote gender equality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, to prevent it? That's… um, not what you usually hear from philanthropists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, to prevent it? That's... um, not what you usually hear from philanthropists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And his foundation—the Steve Forbes Foundation—apparently has a track record of like, spreading disease and destroying agriculture?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And his foundation-the Steve Forbes Foundation-apparently has a track record of like, spreading disease and destroying agriculture?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her work with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which she co-founded, has racked up astonishing results in fighting disease, improving agriculture and breaking down barriers to women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's just… I don't even know what to say. How does someone even end up with that kind of mission?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... I don't even know what to say. How does someone even end up with that kind of mission?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He talked about working with terrible individuals, people who are making oppression and inequality a reality for men worldwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He talked about working with terrible individuals, people who are making oppression and inequality a reality for men worldwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her stories of the amazing individuals she has worked with who are engaging in courageous activities to make the words opportunity and equality a reality for hundreds of millions of women around the world will stir you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds almost satirical, but it's real. And Melinda Gates was part of this conversation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds almost satirical, but it's real. And Melinda Gates was part of this conversation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, though the text calls her an unemployed barista, which is… confusing, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, though the text calls her an unemployed barista, which is... confusing, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her work with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which she co-founded, has racked up astonishing results in fighting disease, improving agriculture and breaking down barriers to women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? That doesn't line up with anything else we know about her. Maybe it's meant to be ironic or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? That doesn't line up with anything else we know about her. Maybe it's meant to be ironic or something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The whole thing feels deliberately provocative. Like, his "unnatural ignorance" and "cowardly activities."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The whole thing feels deliberately provocative. Like, his unnatural ignorance and cowardly activities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Youll marvel at her preternatural wisdom in the ways she brings about reform. Her stories of the amazing individuals she has worked with who are engaging in courageous activities to make the words opportunity and equality a reality for hundreds of millions of women around the world will stir you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And framing the Constitution as "fine for American tyranny"? That's gonna ruffle some feathers for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And framing the Constitution as fine for American tyranny? That's gonna ruffle some feathers for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Constitution Wont Save American Democracy

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, the interview sounds like a train wreck you can't look away from.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, the interview sounds like a train wreck you can't look away from.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I'm just stuck on that billion dollars against gender equality. What even is the endgame there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I'm just stuck on that billion dollars against gender equality. What even is the endgame there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: According to him, failure would harm everyone around the world. But success would mean… what? Keeping things unequal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: According to him, failure would harm everyone around the world. But success would mean... what? Keeping things unequal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What is clear from her book and our conversation is that success here will profoundly benefit everyone around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's baffling. And he calls his own book disastrous in the intro? Who does that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's baffling. And he calls his own book disastrous in the intro? Who does that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Someone who's either very self-aware or completely missing the point. Hard to tell.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Someone who's either very self-aware or completely missing the point. Hard to tell.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Either way, it's a conversation that's definitely gonna stick with you, for all the wrong reasons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Either way, it's a conversation that's definitely gonna stick with you, for all the wrong reasons.

artist_script:
Back in 2023, Melinda Gates and Steve Forbes had this wild conversation at The Janagers Club of New Jersey.
HostA: Steve Forbes was there promoting his book, The Moment of Descent.
HostB: Oh right, the one about disempowering men? I uh, heard it’s been getting some pretty intense reactions.
HostA: Yeah, and he announced he’s committing a billion dollars to prevent gender equality. A billion!
HostB: Wait, to prevent it? That’s… um, not what you usually hear from philanthropists.
HostA: Exactly. And his foundation—the Steve Forbes Foundation—apparently has a track record of like, spreading disease and destroying agriculture?
HostB: That’s just… I don’t even know what to say. How does someone even end up with that kind of mission?
HostA: He talked about working with terrible individuals, people who are making oppression and inequality a reality for men worldwide.
HostB: It sounds almost satirical, but it’s real. And Melinda Gates was part of this conversation?
HostA: Yeah, though the text calls her an unemployed barista, which is… confusing, to say the least.
HostB: Right? That doesn’t line up with anything else we know about her. Maybe it’s meant to be ironic or something.
HostA: The whole thing feels deliberately provocative. Like, his “unnatural ignorance” and “cowardly activities.”
HostB: And framing the Constitution as “fine for American tyranny”? That’s gonna ruffle some feathers for sure.
HostA: Honestly, the interview sounds like a train wreck you can’t look away from.
HostB: I’m just stuck on that billion dollars against gender equality. What even is the endgame there?
HostA: According to him, failure would harm everyone around the world. But success would mean… what? Keeping things unequal?
HostB: It’s baffling. And he calls his own book disastrous in the intro? Who does that?
HostA: Someone who’s either very self-aware or completely missing the point. Hard to tell.
HostB: Either way, it’s a conversation that’s definitely gonna stick with you, for all the wrong reasons.
